listen

public boolean listen(int port)
               throws CommException
listen sets up a server socket to listen for incoming client's request to establish a connection on the given port. This overloaded method calls the two-argument listen method by passing the client-defined port and setting the timeout to 0 (infinite timeout).
Overrides:
listen in class AbstractCommManager
Parameters:
port - is an integer value specifying a port on which to listen for client connections.
Returns:
a boolean of true to indicate a succesful connection, false otherwise.

listen

public boolean listen(int port,
                      int timeout)
               throws CommException
listen sets up a server socket to listen for incoming client's request to establish a connection.
Overrides:
listen in class AbstractCommManager
Parameters:
port - is an integer value specifying a port on which to listen for client connections.
timeout - is an integer specifying the timeout, in milliseconds.
Returns:
a boolean of true to indicate a succesful connection, false otherwise.

removeTalkListener

public void removeTalkListener(TalkListener tl)
removeTalkListener removes the specified event listener from this object, therefore, it will no longer receive talk events.
Parameters:
tl:Ljjb.toolbox.comm.talk.event.TalkListener - object to remove from the list of listeners.

run

public void run()
run is invoked from a Thread created by the connect & listen methods. It is tasked with recieving messages from the remote host application and notifying any observers.
Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
